remarks: Two distinct lines intersect in at most one point, variation.  Theorem 6.21 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 6-Aug-2019.)
statement:
tglineintmo.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglineintmo.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ran L ) $.
tglineintmo.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ran L ) $.
tglineintmo.c $e |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
tglineineq.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( A i^i B ) ) $.
tglineineq.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( A i^i B ) ) $.
tglineineq $p |- ( ph -> X = Y ) $.
